Perform KEGG Metabolite Enrichment Analysis

Source: R/enrichkegg.R
enrichkegg.Rd

Conducts metabolite set enrichment analysis using KEGG pathways and hypergeometric test

enrichkegg(keggid, species, pathway_data, p.adjust.method = "BH")

Arguments

keggid

Character vector of metabolite KEGG IDs (e.g., c("C00022", "C00031")). Must be in short format (without "cpd:" prefix).

species

KEGG species code (e.g., "hsa" for human). Must match the species used in pathway_data.

pathway_data

Pathway data object from getkeggdata

p.adjust.method

p-value adjustment method (default="BH"). Options: "holm", "hochberg", "hommel", "bonferroni", "BH", "BY", "fdr".

Value

A data frame with enrichment results containing these columns:

pathwayID

KEGG pathway ID (e.g., "hsa00010")

Description

Pathway description

PathwaySize

Total metabolites in the pathway (background set size)

Count

Number of significant metabolites mapped to this pathway

MetaRatio

Ratio of significant metabolites (format: significant/total_input)

BgRatio

Background ratio (format: pathway_metabolites/total_background_metabolites)

pvalue

Raw p-value from hypergeometric test

p.adjust

Adjusted p-value using specified method

EnrichmentRatio

Enrichment ratio calculated as (Count/PathwaySize)/(length(keggid)/length(all_background_metabolites)

keggID

Semicolon-separated list of metabolite IDs

Details

The enrichment analysis uses the hypergeometric test with these parameters: $$p = 1 - \sum_{i=0}^{k-1} \frac{{\binom{n}{i} \binom{M-n}{N-i}}}{{\binom{M}{N}}}$$ Where:

  • \(M\): Total metabolites in all pathways (background)

  • \(n\): Metabolites in target pathway

  • \(N\): Significant metabolites in input

  • \(k\): Overlap between pathway and significant metabolites

Note

Only pathways with at least one significant metabolite (Count > 0) are returned. Results are sorted by adjusted p-value in ascending order.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# After getting pathway data with getkeggdata()
sig_metabolites <- c("C00022", "C00031", "C00033")
enrich_results <- enrichkegg(
  keggid = sig_metabolites,
  species = "hsa",
  pathway_data = kegg_data
)

# View top 5 enriched pathways
head(enrich_results, 5)
} # }
